intro: Weinmannia ulei, commonly known as the Hawaiian weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the aster family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically visited by native pollinators. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories on the islands of Hawaii. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in preserving its ecological role.
